meanings.definition: Capable of being raised or built up
meanings.sent1: The toy blocks are erectable, allowing children to create tall towers.
meanings.sent2: The scaffolding is made of erectable materials that can be easily assembled on-site.
meanings.sent3: The inflatable castle was so erectable that it almost seemed to grow on its own!
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like an erectable structure, steadily growing stronger with each success.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a new business was so exciting, it felt like an erectable dream waiting to come true.

meanings.definition: Able to stand upright or be assembled
meanings.sent1: The tent poles are erectable, making it easy to set up camp quickly.
meanings.sent2: The robot's parts are all erectable, allowing for easy assembly by following the instructions.
meanings.sent3: The treehouse was so erectable that even the squirrels wanted to move in!
meanings.sent4: His determination was like an erectable force, standing tall against any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower's stem was so erectable, reaching proudly towards the sky in full bloom.
